intro: Angelica myriostachys, commonly known as the giant angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a tall, herbaceous plant that can grow up to 2 meters in height, with large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces clusters of small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in complex umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas.
